result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen L. Milam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
3 years probation (consecutive to Count 6 in 13CF95), 18 days sentence credit, $843.00 fine.  AODA treatment and follow-through, obtain GED/HSED, Absolute sobriety, DNA sample to be provided and surcharge of $250.00,   Cognitive Group Intervention Program - Critical Thinking Program, DE remain free of gang associations, colors, and symbols.
Consecutive to: Count 6 in 13CF95

miscConds.notes: $843.00.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$250.00.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Cognitive Group Intervention Program - Critical Thinking Program.
Must remain free from gang associations, colors, and symbols.
The Defendant can Petition the the court for Expunction if no further crimes and after having completed the terms of the sentence.
AODA assessment within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
of right to seek postconviction relief.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Stephen L. Milam in court with Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State recites proposed agreement as given last time in court.  Victims supplied a letter to be read in court; State read letter.  Court finds State has complied with victim rights notification.  

DE's attorney states this is DE's first offense, DE would likely respond to treatment and get help he needs.  DE's attorney argues for expunction.  DE addressed court.  Court takes into account the fact that victim's were home at time of offenses and firearms were involved.  Court finds it does not need to incarcerate DE to protect the public if DE's substance abuse problem is addressed; appropriate to place DE on probation.

Count 6 in 13CF95---9 months in Sawyer County Jail, (good time and huber authorized), 10 days credit for time served, must report by 3PM on December 10, 2014, pay fine and costs of $505.

Count 2 in 13CF95---withheld sentence, 3 years probation, consecutive to Count 6.  Conditions of probation:  absolute sobriety, AODA completed by January 23, 2015, complete CGIP successfully, obtain GED or HSED.

14CF80---Count 1, sentence withheld, placed on 3 years probation consecutive to Count 6 in 13CF95.  Same conditions of probation as 13CF95 for Count 2, $843.00 costs plus fine, plus DE must provide DNA sample and pay $250.00 DNA surcharge.

Fine and costs to be paid on a schedule as determined by probation agent.  DE must complete any other programming as deemed appropriate by DOC, have no contact with those associated with any gangs, DE must be free of clothing and gang signs.

FOR FELONY COUNTS ONLY---As to expunction matter, the court does NOT authorize automatic expunction.  The court holds matter open and DE may come before the court and address why appropriate to expunge after successful completion of sentence.

DE read appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing moved to 12/10/14 at request of State - ok w/DE Attorney.  mak
